page.title: 14LOCAL LAND USE
page.content: Millions of years ago during the ice age the glaciers in our area carried a lot of rocks along with them.The large rocks left behind can still be seen on the school moor The strath was once covered with forest but over the centuries people started to clear away the trees for their settlements.Some of these people set up the stone circles still around today. Many of the kings and lairds hunted in the remaning forests for deer or wild boar.More recently rich land owners who spent a lot of their time in the city let the farmland turn into moor covered with heather for the grouse. Now farmers grow crops and keep cows on fertile land around the river and sheep on moorland and hills.Forestry companies are planting many hills with conifers.Sportsmen still shoot game.
